comments:
I'm using M5 on linux with GTK+2

Actually, I'm trying to use M5.  Ever since upgrading I'm having a lot of
problems with the UI sort of locking up (for lack of a better word).  It
is easily reproducible

1.  Ctrl-Shift-T to open a type
2.  Ctrl-Left click to navigate into a referenced type

At this point the referenced type is loaded in the editor, but I can't
navigate at all.  The scrollbar moves, but the contents of the editor do
not.  I can't edit the file or switch to other editors.  I can pull down
menus, but seleting menu items does nothing.  A seems that a single java
thread is completely runing away, sucking 99% CPU.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 2 Feb 17, 2003 11:28:54.129
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.core.resources".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException

	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:95)

The only change to my system recently (which may be a big one) is the change to
GTK+2.2 final.

I bit more information

I've tried several VMs including Sun 1.3.1_02 and 1.4.1, and IBM 1.3.1 and 1.4.0.
Same results with all of them.

I've tried several builds of eclipse including M5, the subsequent integration
builds.  I even tried going back to an integration build before M5 without luck.

Here's the output from ldd on the eclipse binary:
ldd eclipse

Let me know if there is anymore information I can provide.
Move to Platform/UI since this is where the exception occurs.

The fix for http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=31525 seems to have
fixed this as well.
